channel.title: Uml on Tobias Bayer
channel.description: Recent content in Uml on Tobias Bayer

item.title: Eclipse Modeling Framework Reader with metamodels
item.description:
Working with the Eclipse Modeling Framework can save you a lot of time when generating code out of your UML models.

If you have defined a metamodel on top of an UML model that you are trying to read with MWE using org.eclipse.emf.mwe.utils.Reader you may experience the problem that classes with types from your metamodel are not correctly resolved within your XPAND templates. According to this bug report it is not clear if the bug has been really fixed in the newest version of EMF.

As long as a fix is unavailable, you can use the (deprecated) org.eclipse.xtend.typesystem.emf.XmiReader instead. That works perfectly fine for me.

item.title: Duplicate stereotypes in Sparx Enterprise Architect
item.description:
Sparx Enterprise Architect can import UML profiles where you can define your own stereotypes on top of UML.

However, if you define a stereotype with the same name (case insensitively), EA will not be able to determine the correct stereotype as there is no way of selecting the desired profile.

If you export your model to XMI, the stereotype of your UML classes will be set randomly from the profiles that contain a stereotype with that name.
